dt: {bc}to motion with the hands or with something held in them in signal or salute
{bc}to float, play, or shake in an air current {bc}move loosely to and fro {bc}{sx|flutter||}
{bc}to become moved or brandished to and fro
{bc}to move before the wind with a {a_link|wavelike} motion
{bc}to follow a curving line or take a wavy form {bc}{sx|undulate||}
{bc}to swing (something) back and forth or up and down
{bc}to impart a curving or undulating shape to
{bc}to motion to (someone) to go in an indicated direction or to stop {bc}{sx|signal||}
{bc}to gesture with (the hand or an object) in greeting or farewell or in homage
{bc}to dismiss or put out of mind {bc}{sx|disregard||}

pt: {sc}swing{/sc} {sc}wave{/sc} {sc}flourish{/sc} {sc}brandish{/sc} {sc}thrash{/sc} mean to wield or cause to move to and fro or up and down. {sc}swing{/sc} implies regular or uniform movement.
{sc}wave{/sc} usually implies smooth or continuous motion.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}wafian{/it} to wave with the hands; akin to Old English {it}wæfan{/it} to clothe and perhaps to Old English {it}wefan{/it} to weave
shortdef: to motion with the hands or with something held in them in signal or salute
to float, play, or shake in an air current : move loosely to and fro : flutter

dt: {bc}a moving ridge or swell on the surface of a liquid (as of the sea)

dt.t: The buccaneer on the {wi}wave{/wi} might relinquish his calling and become … a man of probity and piety on land …
The sea was open to them, and they achieved their victories on the briny {wi}wave{/wi}.

aq.source: {it}The Book of Commerce by Sea and Land{/it}

dt: {bc}a shape or outline having successive curves
{bc}an undulating line or streak or a pattern formed by such lines
{bc}something that swells and dies away: such as

dt.t: a {wi}wave{/wi} of anger swept over her

dt: {bc}a movement sweeping large numbers in a common direction
{bc}a sweep of hand or arm or of some object held in the hand used as a signal or greeting
{bc}a rolling or undulatory movement or one of a series of such movements passing along a surface or through the air
{bc}a movement like that of an ocean wave: such as

dt.t: a big new {wi}wave{/wi} of women politicians

dt: {bc}one of a succession of influxes of people migrating into a region
{bc}a moving group of animals of one kind
{bc}a sudden rapid increase in a population
{bc}a line of attacking or advancing troops or airplanes
{bc}a display of people in a large crowd (as at a sports event) successively rising, lifting their arms overhead, and quickly sitting so as to form a swell moving through the crowd

{bc}a disturbance or variation that transfers energy progressively from point to point in a medium and that may take the form of an elastic deformation or of a variation of pressure, electric or magnetic intensity, electric potential, or temperature
{bc}one complete cycle of such a disturbance
{bc}a marked change in temperature {bc}a period of hot or cold weather
{bc}an undulating or jagged line constituting a graphic representation of an action

shortdef: a moving ridge or swell on the surface of a liquid (as of the sea)
a shape or outline having successive curves

dt: {bc}a member of the women's component of the U.S. Navy formed during World War II and discontinued in the 1970s

shortdef: a member of the women's component of the U.S. Navy formed during World War II and discontinued in the 1970s

dt: {bc}a partial differential equation of the second order whose solutions describe wave phenomena

shortdef: a partial differential equation of the second order whose solutions describe wave phenomena

dt: {bc}a surface composed at any instant of all the points just reached by a vibrational disturbance in its propagation through a medium

fl: noun, plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}the mathematical description of atomic and subatomic particles in terms of their wave characteristics

shortdef: the mathematical description of atomic and subatomic particles in terms of their wave characteristics

dt: {bc}the number of waves per unit distance of radiant energy of a given wavelength {bc}the reciprocal of the wavelength

shortdef: the number of waves per unit distance of radiant energy of a given wavelength : the reciprocal of the wavelength

dt: {bc}an idea, product, or movement that is viewed as representing forces or a trend that will inevitably prevail

shortdef: an idea, product, or movement that is viewed as representing forces or a trend that will inevitably prevail

dt: {bc}a pulse of radiant energy that is the resultant of a number of wave trains of differing wavelengths
